intro: Gonzalagunia mildredae, commonly known as the mildredae gonzalagunia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
